listings.description:
Summary

Posted: May 17, 2019
Role Number: 200038211
Apple's Compiler Runtime team is looking for a runtime expert to work on the Swift and Objective-C runtime libraries. This software is at the heart of Apple's products, so your contributions in this role will have a huge impact. The ideal candidate will love working on low-level multithreaded system software, creatively handling performance tradeoffs, and even dropping down to assembly code when necessary. The runtime support for Swift is part of the open-source Swift project (https://swift.org), so you will engage with the Swift community on a regular basis. Because the runtime libraries play such a central role in Apple's software platforms, you will also interact with a variety of other teams throughout the company. Swift has grown rapidly since it was introduced in 2014, but we have ambitious goals and there are many exciting features to support in the runtime.
Key Qualifications
  • Strong programming skills with C++ and related development tools
  • Low-level performance tuning experience, including a thorough knowledge of the performance behavior of modern processor architectures
  • Exceptional debugging skills
  • Experience writing thread-safe code while maintaining high performance
  • Commitment to constant improvement of software development practices, especially careful attention to testing
  • You bring passion and dedication to your job and are committed to building a quality product
Description
The Swift and Objective-C runtimes provide the low-level support for these programming languages, implementing things like reference counting and method dispatch. As a runtime engineer, you will work on all aspects of these libraries. High performance is key for this code, so you will need to carefully evaluate changes to squeeze out every last drop of speed. You will design and implement support for new products and features in close collaboration with other teams, so strong communication and teamwork skills will be important. A significant component of this job will be maintaining the existing code and investigating reports of problems from both internal Apple engineers and external app developers. Those problems are often hard to reproduce so you will need to figure out the causes from a few clues and find creative ways to collect more information when necessary. Come join us to help solve these challenges! The position is based onsite at Apple's campus in Cupertino, California. International candidates are welcome to apply but will need to relocate; the company will sponsor a visa.
Education & Experience
Bachelor of Science in Computer Science or equivalent experience.
Additional Requirements

The following are desirable but not required:

  • Deep understanding of Objective-C and Swift
  • Experience with programming language implementation
  • Experience contributing to open source projects

Job Location
Multiple locations (USA)

We are looking for an Frontend AEM Developer who can create custom web development. This position will be responsible for taking projects through the entire life cycle. You will tackle problems and resolve complex issues, while working in a distributed environment. If you have the ambition to lead frontend projects, that rocks. And we want to hear from you!

Role and Responsibilities

  • Write well designed, efficient code that works across devices
  • Build reusable components with HTML (Adobe’s templating language), CSS and JavaScript
  • Support continuous improvement by staying up-to-date with the rapidly evolving frontend world
  • Develop mission-critical authoring and user experience
  • Actively participate in client meetings

Preferred Qualifications

  • 3+ years of professional hands-on Frontend Development experience
  • The ideal candidate will have a 2- or 4-year degree in CS/Engineering, be a bootcamp grad, or be self-taught with practical experience
  • Built sites using: AEM 6.1 and above. Proficiency with AEM Components, Dialogs, Templates and ClientLibs
  • An understanding of design and the ability to fill gaps, for example if a design doesn’t cover all screen sizes or if a design isn’t consistent
  • Be willing to work with the latest frontend tools and technologies, such as SCSS, Webpack, ES6 JavaScript, TypeScript and Storybook.js
  • Strong communication and problem solving skills
  • Experience with platforms other than AEM, such as Drupal or Magento, is helpful
  • Worked in an Agile development, specifically SCRUM, is preferred
Bounteous is focused on promoting an inclusive environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate the different viewpoints and experiences our diverse group of team members bring to Bounteous. We are looking for a Backend AEM Developer who can create custom web development. This position will be responsible for taking projects through the entire life cycle. You will tackle problems and resolve complex issues, while working in a distributed environment. A successful team member will be proactive and be collaborative!

Roles and Responsbilities

  • Develop mission-critical systems, delivering high-availability and performance.
  • Contribute in all phases of the development lifecycle and understand the entire software development process from design to development to deployment to maintenance.
  • Write well designed, testable, efficient code.
  • Prepare and produce releases of software components.
  • Support continuous improvement by investigating alternatives and technologies.
  • Actively participate in client meetings, possess top-notch written and oral communication skills, and be able to tailor messages that fit your audience.
  • Have a deep understanding of cross-browser compatibility issues and approaches .
  • Possess cutting-edge grasp of SEO-friendly and sound analytics practices.
  • Drive test-driven development and Agile development practices.
  • Require minimal supervision, provide oversight for assigned projects, and get things done without being micromanaged.
  • Periodically travel to client locations.
  • Use best practice version control methodologies and tools such as Git or SVN.
  • Work fast with an attention to detail within a fast-paced work environment with hard deadlines.

Preferred Qualifications

  • The ideal candidate will have a 2- or 4-year degree in CS/Engineering, be a bootcamp grad, or be self-taught with practical experience
  • 5+ years of professional hands-on AEM Software Development experience and experience building sites using AEM 6.1+.
  • 5+ years of deep experience in Java development in a professional environment, and proficiency with Sling.
  • Solid understanding of systems design, caching, and persistence.
  • Strong communication, problem solving, and consultancy skills.
  • Familiarity with modern programming architecture.
  • Basic knowledge of containerization (i.e., Docker)
  • Worked with Agile development, preferably SCRUM, and Unit Testing / TDD.
  • Experience using Jira and OpenAir/NetSuite a plus.
Bounteous is focused on promoting an inclusive environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate the different viewpoints and experiences our diverse group of team members bring to Bounteous. Bounteous does not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, physical or mental disability, national origin, veteran status, or any other status protected under federal, state, or local law.

Responsibilities:


THIS IS A W2 POSITION


Create and implement software design specifications
Perform code analysis, requirements analysis, identification of code metrics, system risk analysis, and software reliability analysis
Performance tuning, improvement, balancing, usability, and automation.
Write readable, extensible, testable code, while being mindful of performance requirements
Create, maintain, and run unit tests for both new and existing code with a goal of delivering defect-free code.

Required Skills/Experience:
Bachelor’s degree in Information Technology or Computer Science
5+ years experience in architecting, designing, and building large scale distributed, service-oriented systems and web applications in an agile environment
At least 2-3 years of commercial web development experience with Javascript/Typescript

Bounteous is seeking a Digital Developer and Campaign Specialist to join its team of talented professionals who provide web development and interactive marketing services to clients large and small.

This specialist needs to be an independent worker who is detail oriented and highly organized. A positive, customer service oriented, and problem solving attitude is a must for this role that involves meeting the demands of both a fixed marketing calendar and frequent client requests. This job involves exacting standards and unforgiving schedules—the work must be done on time (although some items can be set-up in advance) and error-free.

Role and Responsibilities

  • Deep knowledge of and experience with email marketing best practices, innovations and connections to the email marketing community
  • Understand, plan and implement complex audience targeting schema within Adobe Campaign Classic
  • Be the lead on multiple email, SMS, and push campaigns during the week which you would review the test plan, set up the campaign, pull proofs, QA, deploy and monitor
  • Troubleshoot any errors that occur with the campaign or with any of the technical workflows within Adobe Campaign
  • Provide QA for email designs, templates, outbound email campaigns with the goal of a 0% error rate
  • Attend and be engaged in daily team stand-ups addressing the upcoming marketing calendar
  • Actively communicate through various outlets in a transparent fashion while also presenting detailed agendas and minutes to teams, clients, production, and the organization
  • Use web-based email management software- specifically setting up, previewing, testing, troubleshooting and monitoring email blasts
  • Strategy and planning skills, including understanding and setting up email calendars, anticipating marketing-related holidays and events
  • Perform campaign analysis to influence broader marketing strategy and contribute to client ROI
  • Maintain daily interaction to update clients and coworkers on project progress
  • Create professional deliverables for clients that meet the Bounteous quality standard
  • Assess and advise complex situations across internal and external client teams
  • Reports to Email Campaign Manager and Senior Digital Developer and Campaign Specialist

Preferred Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s degree
  • Willing to work evenings and weekends when necessary
  • 2-5 years of related experience with Email Marketing and set-up as well as Adobe Campaign Classic; SMS and Push Channel experience preferred
  • Willing to work evenings and weekends when necessary
  • Collaborated with both internal resources, external resources to develop strategies that meet department goals within budget and established timelines
  • Experience in diagnosing, isolating, and resolving complex issues and recommending and implementing strategies to resolve problems
  • Experience developing strategic initiatives which align with business goals and budget
  • Presentation skills and/or public speaking experience is a huge bonus
  • Experience in business analysis, project management, and web analytics
  • Fluent in HTML
Bounteous is focused on promoting an inclusive environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate the different viewpoints and experiences our diverse group of team members bring to Bounteous. Bounteous does not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, physical or mental disability, national origin, veteran status, or any other status protected under federal, state, or local law.

Bounteous is willing to sponsor eligible candidates for employment visas.

Role Summary:

GE Healthcare is looking for a Software Engineer to work on a number of exciting projects that will have a very positive impact on GE’s business. You will be responsible for programming a feature and or a small feature set. You will contribute to the team and works with direction from the Senior Team Members or management but works independently.

Essential Responsibilities:

In this role, you will:
  • Act as a member of the Software Center of Excellence, representing the face of high quality
    design and development practices
  • Develop high performing, scaling and innovative end-to-end web applications
  • Collaborate with system engineers, frontend developers and software developers to
    implement solutions that are aligned with and extend shared platforms and solutions
  • Apply principles of SDLC and methodologies like Lean/Agile/XP, CI, Software and Product
    Security, Scalability, Documentation Practices, refactoring and Testing Techniques
  • Writes codes that meets standards and delivers desired functionality using the technology
    selected for the project
  • Build features such as web services and Queries on existing tables
  • Understand performance parameters and assess application performance
    o Work on core data structures and algorithms and implement them using language of choice

Qualifications/Requirements:

Basic Qualifications:
  • Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or in “STEM” Majors (Science, Technology,
    Engineering and Math) and a minimum of 2 years of professional experience or a Master's
    Degree
  • 2 years of experience in Java development, Spring boot, RESTful web services.
  • 2 years of working experience in application development using agile methodology
  • Experience with data structures and algorithms.
  • GE Leadership Program Graduates will get credit towards relevant work experience,
    commensurate to the program they have completed
Eligibility Requirements:
  • Legal authorization to work in the U.S. is required. GE may agree to sponsor an individual
    for an employment visa now or in the future if there is a shortage of individuals with particular skills.
  • Must be willing to work out of an office located in downtown Seattle, WA

Desired Characteristics:

Technical Expertise:
  • Experience developing web applications on cloud (AWS, Python, DynamoDB, RESTful Services)
  • Experience with front-end technologies such as JavaScript, HTML5, CSS, Angular,
    Node.js
  • Experience with AWS services (CFT, S3, Lambdas, API Gateways)
  • Experience with modern tooling (Gradle/Maven, Git)
Business Acumen:
  • Have a solid understanding of the underlying infrastructure needed to run a large distributed
    web application
  • Has the ability to break down problems and estimate time for development tasks
  • Has the ability to make basic technology choices based on experience
  • Demonstrates awareness about competitors and industry
Leadership:
  • Has the ability to take ownership of small tasks and deliver without supervision while using
    their discretion to seek help when necessary
  • Voices opinions and presents clear rationale. Uses data or factual evidence to influence
  • Recognizes collaborative behavior and participates in collaborative activities
  • Learns organization vision statement and decision-making framework. Able to understand
    how team and personal goals/objectives contribute to the organization vision
Personal Attributes:
  • Demonstrate the ability to help team members
    o Seeks to understand problems thoroughly before implementing solutions. Asks questions to
    clarify requirements when ambiguities are present
  • Identifies opportunities for innovation and offers new ideas. Takes the initiative to
    experiment with new software frameworks
  • Adapts to new environments and changing requirements. Pivots quickly as needed. When
    coached, responds to need & seeks info from other sources

About Us:

GE (NYSE:GE) drives the world forward by tackling its biggest challenges. By combining world-class engineering with software and analytics, GE helps the world work more efficiently, reliably, and safely. GE people are global, diverse and dedicated, operating with the highest integrity and passion to fulfill GE’s mission and deliver for our customers. www.ge.com
GE offers a great work environment, professional development, challenging careers, and competitive compensation. GE is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, gender (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, veteran status or any other characteristics protected by law.

Additional Eligibility Qualifications:

GE will only employ those who are legally authorized to work in the United States for this opening. Any offer of employment is conditioned upon the successful completion of a drug screen (as applicable).

Additional Locations:

United States;Washington;Seattle;

Contact : hr@MindwaveSol.com or Attn: H.R.D, Mindwave Solutions Inc, 295 Durham Ave, Suite# 203, South Plainfield, NJ 07080

Boeing Supply Chain and Operations is looking for a Hybris Lead Developer based out of Plano, Texas.

Position Responsibilities:

  • Work with business stakeholders and technical teams to align technical & project scope. Create and maintain system architecture and design documentation, communicate it and ensure everyone is using it correctly
  • Provide oversight and approval of technical approaches, products and processes. Determine architecturally significant requirements. Define technical risks & mitigation strategy and define technical dependencies & dependency management strategy
  • Experience in successfully designing, developing, testing (including unit test automation) and deploying (including deployment automation) of SAP Hybris & J2EE applications. Understanding of load balancing, authentication and fault tolerance through Tomcat application server, Apache webserver and F5 load balancer & CDN
  • Anticipate & effectively resolve problems / issues and roadblocks, constantly follow through on details while driving innovation as well as issue resolution. Technically monitor the implementation / deliverables of the technical team during development lifecycle and provide guidance & clarification to the development team
  • Apply appropriate estimating techniques to determine the level of effort and financial investment required for the technical implementation of the solution
  • Provide technical direction and guidance to others regarding approved processes, tools, technology and skills for own projects or processes. Communicates the development process (including iterative & agile) to the team members. Review and provide approvals for the deliverables of the team
  • Mentor team members performing engineering & technical activities in the area of software engineering. Provide periodic updates to the management in the form of progress report, project summaries and other related documents
  • Must have expert understanding of standard product functionality in Hybris, ability to guide developers in building technical solutions predominantly using Hybris standard functionality and keeping customizations to the minimum, reviews and implements pull requests, performs peer code reviews, suggests and performs technical design reviews, ensures First Time Quality starting from design, development through implementation
  • Must discuss opportunities and solutions with architecture team, come up with the best design solutions for current and scaling the eComm environments
  • Must be a self-starter with positive attitude, high ethics and track record of working successfully under pressure in a time constraint environment.
  • Experience of working in Agile teams while following the Agile & SAFe practices on software craftsmanship such as test-driven development & pair programming / peer reviews
  • The selected individual would need to work in shift hours (US) to support the business, technical and project teams in US or other geographical locations
  • This position will support initiatives of Boeing organization related to engineering excellence, employee development, mentoring, customer engagement, etc.
  • Communication: Deliver informative, well-organized presentations, understand how to communicate difficult / sensitive information tactfully, excellent verbal & written communication skills
  • Must have working experience with cross-functional teams spread across multiple products and locations within Boeing and external partners across different cultures and time-zones
  • Experienced in best practices and tools around CI/CD
  • Experienced in Agile / Scrum based software development methodology
  • Have knowledge around public cloud AWS & Azure and cloud based development
  • Excellent knowledge and experience in building testable, scalable, flexible, robust and efficient ecommerce applications using Java / J2EE technologies specifically related to SAP Hybris ecommerce platform or similar applications
  • Experience in successfully developing, testing (including unit test automation) and deploying (including deployment automation) of SAP Hybris & J2EE applications. Understanding of load balancing, authentication and fault tolerance through Tomcat application server, Apache webserver and F5 load balancer & CDN
  • Experienced in test-driven development and using the industry best practices with an ability to write new test suites and enhance current test suite using selenium
  • Excellent Hands on experience in understanding complex eCommerce challenges / problems and provide innovative solutions & design to solve them. One should be able to pass on solutions / design to junior team members while fascinating them in delivering complex deliverables
  • Excellent Hands on experience in understanding complex eCommerce challenges / problems and provide innovative solutions & design to solve them
  • Ability to build solutions / design and guide junior team members to deliver solutions with first time quality
  • Effort distribution – architecture / design / development (50%), maintenance / support / enhancement and deployment (50%)
  • Travel domestically and internationally as required

Variable Shift (if applicable):

Must be willing to work variable shifts, including weekends and overtime. Some positions may also be rotating shifts

Relocation:

Relocation assistance is not a negotiable benefit for this position. Candidates must live in the immediate area or relocate at their own expense.

Drug Free Workplace:

Boeing is a Drug Free Workplace where post offer applicants and employees are subject to testing for marijuana, cocaine, opioids, amphetamines, PCP, and alcohol when criteria is met as outlined in our policies.

Additional Information:

All information provided will be checked and may be verified.

Please apply as soon as possible for this role as recruitment may commence before the end date.

At Boeing, we are all innovators on a mission to connect, protect, explore and inspire. From the seabed to outer space, you’ll learn and grow, contributing to work that shapes the world. Find your future with us.

Basic Qualifications (Required Skills/Experience):

  • Employer willing to sponsor applicants for employment visa status if applicable.
  • 5+ years’ experience using JavaScript
  • 5+ years’ experience working in eCommerce
  • 5+ years’ experience working on a SAP platform
  • 5+ years’ experience with Angular and Java
  • 5+ years’ experience with RestAPIs
  • 5+ years’ experience web development or content management systems

Preferred Qualifications (Desired Skills/Experience):

  • Expert in architecting, designing and building ecommerce applications using J2EE technologies
  • Excellent expertise in ecommerce tools & technologies such as Hybris 6.x, J2EE, Spring(combined with a lot), JSP & Servlets, Angular JS & Node JS, REST / SOAP APIs, JUnit, CSS & HTML 5
  • Architecture, design & develop full stack modules and components for eCommerce applications
  • Good working knowledge on integrations such as payment (Pay metrics), SAP, OpenText, web services, etc.
  • Effective in resolving problems and roadblocks by consistently following through on details while driving Innovation as well as issue resolution
  • Experienced in test-driven development and using the industry best practices
  • Familiarity with using SAP ECC ERP application
  • Awareness SAP PI / EDI based integrations
  • Knowledge of Dynatrace, AppDynamics, Akamai
  • ITIL practices
  • Candidate should have strong computing skills, excellent communication skills, be customer-oriented, positive, flexible, and a strong team player.

Typical Education/Experience:

Education/experience typically acquired through advanced technical education (e.g. Bachelor) and typically 14 or more years' related work experience or an equivalent combination of technical education and experience (e.g. PhD+9 years' related work experience, Master+12 years' related work experience, 18 years' related work experience, etc.).

Role Summary:
Are you looking to make a meaningful impact? To solve real problems, many different skills need to come together. That is why we come together as a team to solve the toughest and most impactful industrial problems.

Essential Responsibilities:

Collaborate with Artificial Intelligence Researchers and world-class multidisciplinary teams to address knowledge representation, reasoning, text mining and Big Data problems in an applied research environment. Develop and deploy novel artificial intelligence solutions for knowledge capture, representation and reasoning, semantic modeling, information extraction, text mining, massive-scale/Big Data management and analytic execution to capture, digitize, model and learn from real-world industrial data. Familiarity with large structure and unstructured data sets, cloud-based development and deployment, open source practices and frameworks and experience in putting intelligent applications in production are desirable.

In this role, you will:

  • Develop, test, and deploy semantics, natural language processing, big data and machine learning algorithms/solutions to solve industrial problems at GE
  • Learn about state-of-the-art methodologies and how they can be adapted and improved for industrial applications
  • Architect and develop toolkits for use by researchers and businesses
  • Interface closely with GE Business counterparts to understand requirements, domain knowledge/models, and data needs
  • Effectively communicate technical analyses and results



Qualifications/Requirements:

  • Master’s
    Degree in Computer Science, Computer/Systems Engineering, Mathematics,
    Engineering or related field

  • Experience
    with W3C Semantics (RDF, OWL, SPARQL), Big Data (e.g. Apache Spark),
    and/or natural language processing techniques

  • Hands-on
    ability to implement, test, and deploy solutions in an industrial
    context

  • Programming
    experience using modern programming languages and frameworks (e.g. Java,
    Python, Spark, Spring-Boot, etc.)
  • Legal authorization to work in the U.S. is required. GE may agree to sponsor an individual for an employment visa now or in the future if there is a shortage of individuals with particular skills

  • Must
    be willing to work out of an office located in Niskayuna, NY

  • Must
    be 18 years or older

  • You
    must submit your application for employment on the careers page at www.gecareers.com to be considered



Desired Characteristics:
  • Experience in applying semantics, Big Data, and/or natural language processing algorithms to industrial problems
  • Interest/Experience in large data sets, cloud-based architectures and deployment frameworks for semantic or natural language processing algorithms
  • Strong analytical skills
  • Teamwork and customer focus



About Us:
GE Research is GE's innovation engine where new ideas are originated, developed and productized to create a better world and deliver differentiated products across the company's industrial portfolio. These products span the aviation, power, transportation and health care sectors.

Today, we're a forward leaning, interdisciplinary organization, matching world-class innovation with market insights and industry connections to move faster and deliver better outcomes for GE’s businesses and customers.

We continue a strong track record in innovation and invention that began with our company's founder, Thomas Edison. GE scientists and engineers have distinguished themselves over time, amassing tens of thousands of patents, two Nobel prizes in chemistry and physics, and a list of inventions that have defined and redefined generation after generation.

This rich legacy of delivering transformative innovation is thriving now more than ever.

Discover how we’re seeing, moving and creating the future at https://www.ge.com/research/, meet our innovation giants at https://www.ge.com/research/people, search our open positions at http://twitter.com/geresearchjobs, and connect with us on our social channels at https://twitter.com/GEResearch and https://www.linkedin.com/company/geresearch/.

Role Summary:

    GE Power builds world class mission-critical systems that manage power flow across the globe. We’re looking for a DevOps engineer to take ownership of the product delivery process. As a member of the software product engineering team you’ll be the main contact for our CI/CD pipeline. You’ll work closely with developers and testers and liaise with global project delivery teams to keep these systems running whilst continually improving them.

    Essential Responsibilities:

  • Responsibilities include staging, managing environments for continuous building and deploying product
  • Overall focus will be on continuous improvement of the product delivery process
  • Maintain software development CI/CD process, be an expert in system deployment and configuration and be instrumental in driving migration to a full DevOps solution
  • Provide support for test automation and static code analysis integration with our CI/CD processes
  • Capture system level installation and maintenance requirements
  • Create and maintain product installation and configuration material for use by delivery engineers
  • Seek to streamline the product deployment process with a strong focus on quality
  • Integrate software applications. Designs solutions integration and works with Product Architects to improve system scalability and exceed performance requirements
  • Performs software development, scripting, configuration, installation and testing tasks
  • Completes advanced tasks in diagnosing and fixing systems and applications problems
  • Interfaces with integrator, project managers, project engineers and customers on general and specific issues within area of functional expertise
  • Function as an integral member of the agile product development team, performing assigned system integration and testing tasks
  • Works directly with the product developers, project engineers or customers to resolve product technical issues
  • Provides support for DevOps, CI/CD process demonstrations to potential customers and industry events

    Qualifications/Requirements:

    Basic Qualifications:

  • Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or in “STEM” Majors (Science, Technology, Engineering and Math)
  • A minimum of 3 years of professional experience

    Eligibility Requirements:

  • Eligibility Requirements Legal authorization to work in the U.S. is required. GE may agree to sponsor an individual for an employment visa now or in the future if there is a shortage of individuals with particular skills

    Desired Characteristics:

  • Minimum 3 years’ experience in the technology space with emphasis on software development, deployment, testing or support
  • At least 5 years of software design, development, testing and/or operational administration experience with a strong focus on quality throughout the entire build and delivery cycle
  • A record of strong collaboration with cross functional teams to deliver results
  • Previous DevOps experience in Jenkins pipeline environments
  • Proven experience implementing large-scale operational automation platforms
  • Experience with highly available Linux server environments
  • Proficiency with modern version control systems, including GitHub
  • Knowledge of test automation tools such as Fitness, Katalon Studio, Cucumber etc.
  • Knowledge of static code analysis tools such as Coverity.
  • Strong software development and integration skills.
  • Experience with highly complex hardware and software configurations in a real-time
  • Experience with Kubernetes and docker as deployment platform.
  • Excellent written and oral communication skills
  • Excellent judgment skills to assess high-risk areas
  • Excellent analytical skills and attention to detail
  • Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and be an outstanding team player
  • Ability to be creative, efficient, and productive with minimal supervision or guidance
  • Development experience and/or object-oriented programming skills such as C/C++ and Java

Role Summary:

    The Senior Education Services Instructor is responsible for the delivery of classroom and on-line technical training that meets and exceeds the expectations of our customers. This position reports to the Global Education and Consulting Services Director and works integrally with associated teams to create, manage, coordinate and deliver training (globally) to customers and external partners.

    Essential Responsibilities:

    This will include select duties as content developer of classroom and on-line material, project manager and trainer. Successful candidates must work cross-functionally with Engineering, Marketing, and Services teams in the delivery of training programs. Opportunities to contribute in consulting services are also available, as well as autonomous management of local training projects and activities.

  • Delivers technical training including lecture, demonstration, and supervision of labs in the classroom.
  • Acts as technical lead on specification, design, development and implementation of new and existing courses while ensuring the customer’s needs are meet.
  • Ensure lab materials are practical and useful, including installation, testing, integration of software.
  • Performs classroom setup to develop and deliver end-user training.
  • Travel 50-75% of the time to deliver onsite courses.
  • Supporting other instructors on various training projects.
  • Use VMware images in training
  • Use online teaching and meeting tools to delivery on-line courses.
  • Work with other instructors to improve training materials and delivery.
  • Works with subject matter experts to develop accurate content and to conduct periodic reviews to validate that instructional element is meeting mutually educational criteria.
  • Perform all aspects of designing and writing systems curricula by gleaning critical technical information from multiple online manuals, user and system documentation, and customer technical correspondence.
  • Identifies opportunities for continuous process and relationship improvements between training, training materials fulfillment, documentation and technical writing.
  • Participates in ensuring that training standards, policies, procedures, and templates are followed.
  • Takes ownership of any projects assigned, taking a leadership role from conception to completion.
  • Other duties may be assigned to meet business needs.

    Qualifications/Requirements:

    Basic Qualifications:

  • Bachelor’s Degree from an accredited university or college with a minimum of 6 years’ work experience OR High School Diploma/GED with a minimum of 10 years of professional experience

    Eligibility Requirements:

  • GE may agree to sponsor an individual for an employment visa now or in the future if there is a shortage of individuals with particular skills.
  • Must be willing to travel 50%

    Desired Characteristics:

  • Strong verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills.
  • Ability to write professional and technical reports and procedures.
  • Ability to make formal and informal presentations to technical and non-technical staff and customers.
  • Experience with GE Grid Software Solution Products, especially AEMS Platform (formally e-terraplatform), AEMS Reliance (formerly PowerOn Reliance) and ADMS Series 3 (formerly e-terradistribution).
  • Experience in industry with controls, automation and/or MES - especially GE.
  • Experience with Software products.
  • Experience with databases (Oracle / SQL), Crystal Reports, SAP, Salesforce.com, website design, html and programming.
  • Project management/execution skills.
  • Experience in Information Technology or similar field. Comfortable in an IT-rich environment.
  • Knowledge of instructional design methodology and experience applying it to adult learners in a highly technical environment, or the ability to learn adult education principles.
  • Excellent PC skills required, including use of VMware, Norton Ghost, Partition Magic and MS Office applications. MS PowerPoint a must.
  • Experience with complex computer applications, presentation graphics and preparation of instructional materials. Familiarity with the electric utility industry preferred and as mentioned above the GE Digital Energy EMS products.
  • Computer-Based Training development desirable.
  • Ability to prioritize work assignments and shift work efforts based on the needs of the department or business goals.
  • Ability to work independently and be self-motivated.
  • Ability to work effectively in a team environment.
  • Demonstrates a high degree of personal and professional integrity.
  • Ability to work non-standard hours to accommodate business needs.
  • Show successful time management skills in a fast paced multi-opportunity environment

The primary purpose of this position is to lead the product/consumer portion of projects to develop and commercialize product improvement ideas/concepts for Huggies Little Movers Diapers, Huggies Little Snugglers and Huggies Snug & Dry diapers following concepts from the Innovation Pathway. This role will work in conjunction with the R&E BCC Product Team Members, Project Teams and the BCC cross-functional organization. The candidate reports to an R&E Manager and receives work direction from a Technical Leader and Project Manager and will provide direction to junior product developers.

Customers:

NA BCC R&E Product Platform Team, BCC R&E, BCC Marketing/Marketing Research and Global R&E

Key Responsibilities:

  • Lead product development efforts for single or multiple projects from explore through commercialization.
  • Lead development and execution of product design strategy to deliver desired consumer benefits while ensuring alignment with Vision/Migration plans.
  • Lead development of product key milestones, budget, timeline, and resource forecast for assigned project(s).
  • Manage development and lead execution of learning plan in conjunction with Marketing Research and Innovation Testing teams
  • Ensure development and execution of product specification and quality plans appropriate for phase of project.
  • Facilitate discussions with marketing and the design team regarding claims and aesthetics.
  • Screen, refine and commercialize several product improvement ideas to deliver on Innovation path for Huggies Little Movers, Huggies Little Snugglers and Huggies Snug & Dry Diaper Innovation Pathway, Funnel and Project Chartering.
  • Complete documentation, coach Jr. Team Member documentation and present to a steering team for endorsement.
  • Protect and defend K-C proprietary product and technology through the appropriate use of patents and trade secrets.
  • Ensure all work complies with corporate safety, regulatory, product safety and sustainability requirements.
  • Interface effectively with the other work stream teams to insure business success.
  • Mentor junior scientists.

Qualifications:

Required

  • Bachelor’s degree from an accredited college/university with 10+ years of experience
  • Broad experiences in product development
  • Experience in executing consumer or technical / scientific studies.
  • Effectively communicates with leaders and influence leaders / team members across all levels of the R&E organization.
  • Ability to provide work direction to team members not in a direct reporting relationship
  • Demonstrated strengths in these skills: creativity, early to commercialization stages of product development, scientific experimentation methods, analysis, coaching and planning/organizing

Preferred

  • Significant work experience in Research & Engineering organization.
    Experience in executing both consumer and technical studies.
  • Has demonstrated skills in turning consumer insights and translating those into tangible product improvement/ innovation opportunities.
  • Experience in the D&C stages of product development
  • Proven subject matter expert on market research methodologies and test methods.
  • Strong understanding of diaper products, brands, business and technologies.
  • Strong mentoring skills
  • Learning Plan development for Innovation Projects

Other

  • 30% Travel
  • No Direct Reports, Provides Work Direction to 1-2 Jr. Product Developer(s)

Role Summary:
    GE Power builds world class mission-critical systems that manage power flow across globe. Seeking Software Development Engineer in Test (SDET) to ensure systems are highest quality. Ideal candidate will thrive in dynamic, results-driven, team-oriented environment & have passion for using automated solutions to test software applications & services. Work in agile environment, have solid coding & testing experience in C#, C++ or similar languages, & experience using multiple testing frameworks.

    Essential Responsibilities:

  • Design and execute automated tests throughout our continuous delivery (CD) system
  • Create, develop and maintain testing frameworks and tools to meet the needs of our customers and engineering teams
  • Work with developers, testers, and product managers to identify, reproduce, and resolve defects
  • Participate in requirements gathering, story writing, design and test reviews
  • Develop automated performance tests that demonstrate our systems scale
  • Create innovative testing solutions as needed, utilizing both GE and third-party technologies
  • Cover both white, grey and black box testing of our applications and assist developers with unit testing
  • Interface with project managers, project engineers and customers on general and specific issues
  • Provide strong technical leadership

    Qualifications/Requirements:

    Basic Qualifications:

  • Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or in “STEM” Majors (Science, Technology, Engineering and Math)
  • A minimum of 5 years of professional experience in the technology space with emphasis on software development and testing.

    Eligibility Requirements

  • Legal authorization to work in the U.S. is required. GE may agree to sponsor an individual for an employment visa now or in the future if there is a shortage of individuals with particular skills
  • Must be willing to work out of office located in Melbourne FL or Redmond WA

    Desired Characteristics:

  • Requires five (5) years software design, integration and/or testing in one or more of the following technologies: C#, C++ and or similar languages. Good experience with common testing frameworks and tools, such as xUnit and Selenium.
  • Great understanding of software design principles, patterns, algorithms, data structures, and multi-threading concepts.
  • Thorough knowledge of modern software development practices, including continuous delivery
  • Experience translating requirements, use-cases and stories into test plans, test cases and automated tests
  • Ability to leverage, utilize and extend industry-standard test automation frameworks, tools and practices
  • 4 to 6 years of professional experience testing multi-tiered client-server systems.
  • Able to demonstrate competence and self-motivation in analyzing problems and performing root cause analysis
  • Ability to take work on multiple projects simultaneously. Prioritization.
  • Excellent written and oral communication skills
  • Excellent judgment skills to assess high-risk areas
  • Excellent analytical skills and attention to detail
  • Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and be an outstanding team player
  • Ability to be creative, efficient, and productive with minimal supervision or guidance

Role Summary:

    You will be a key member of a core team of ten+ senior/expert engineers who are responsible for enhancing, evolving, and supporting a large on-premises highly-available Electricity Market system. The team includes expertise in power systems, market systems, databases, user interfaces, web services, optimization, high availability, and DevOps. Your role will be focused on the market system as a whole and its evolution in response to changes in market protocols, operations, and technology.

    Essential Responsibilities:

  • Be a key member of the project core team that maintains, enhances, and supports the market system and our customer’s use of it.
  • Work with the customer to help translate their market system needs into actionable written requirements.
  • Help the team and the customer translate market requirements into functional design changes.
  • Work with subsystem owners to identify and document system and subsystem design changes to satisfy the new requirements. This includes in many situations being the lead and managing author for incremental design documents that translate the requirements into changes across the system
  • The candidate will be comfortable reviewing, commenting on, and integrating document inputs provided by other team members. In addition, the candidate will iterate on the document in response to team member and customer review feedback.
  • Support subsystem developers as they work to implement and integrate changes into the system. This will often include executing independent testing of the changes and system level functional and regression testing. It could also involve some coding, debugging, or code reviews.
  • Provide system level support to the customer in the form of answering questions and helping resolve and identify problems in the system.
  • Contribute to the team objective of each member expanding their understanding of the system beyond their respective areas of expertise.

    Qualifications/Requirements:

    Basic Qualifications:

  • Bachelor’s degree and at least 6 years of professional experience OR Master’s Degree with a minimum of 4 years of experience.

    Eligibility Requirements:

  • GE may agree to sponsor an individual for an employment visa now or in the future if there is a shortage of individuals with particular skills.

    Desired Characteristics:

  • Deep knowledge and understanding of electricity markets, power system applications, the differences between day-ahead and real-time markets, and how the market interacts with EMS functions.
  • Familiarity with optimization, co-optimization, and the problems that SCUC and SCED solve.
  • A natural ability to think and work at the system level, and form and maintain a mental model of how the collection of applications in a system work together.
  • The ability and expertise to communicate clearly in written form as well as verbally. The position includes writing requirements, design, and testing documents that are shared with the customer.
  • A strong programming background in power systems or market applications and an interest in IT systems.
  • At least five years of experience doing EMS or Markets application design and development.
  • At least three years working for, or with, an RTO or ISO on market design, application support, or operations.
  • The candidate will demonstrate an aptitude, interest, and understanding of the whole system in which their prior experience was gained.
  • Experience in Energy Management Systems (EMS) or Wholesale Electricity Market Systems software services
  • Enjoys working on big complex systems that are important to society.
  • You are comfortable and good at debugging complex software that you may not have written in order to determine how it works or why it is not working.
  • Your curiosity does not end at your historical area of expertise, you naturally work to extend your sphere of knowledge of the greater system.
  • You excel in an environment where everything may not be known. You ask good questions to help the team and the customer resolve the unknowns. You are also comfortable saying “I do not know” when that is the case.
  • You enjoy working within a team and you put a high value on interacting with the customer and the team throughout the software lifecycle.
  • Professional programming experience in C++, Java, and/or PL/SQL.
  • You have at least basic SQL skills.
  • Experience in working in software development environments that include the day-to-day use of code management systems such as Git or TFS.
  • You have a willingness and curiosity to take on any task to help the customer and help the team be successful.
  • The idea of working on a system that helps to “keep the lights on” across a large swath of the United States and enables the increased use of renewable energy intrigues and motivates you.

Senior Developer and Application Architect Claims

Our direct client has an immediate opening for a Senior Developer and Application Architect supporting its implementation of the Duck Creek Insurance Platform. The position is in our Boston, MA office. They provide commercial property, casualty, healthcare professional liability, surety, executive and professional lines insurance to global customers. They are in the process of implementing a long range technology platform strategy with the Duck Creek policy, claims and billing modules being a cornerstone.

Note: All those authorized to work in the US are encouraged to apply. Our client is able to transfer H1B visas and sponsor GC process.

Summary

They are looking to fill a role leading the technical architecture and development of major components of our Claims platform. Expectations include splitting time between architecting solutions, hands-on development of complex capabilities, and directing the technical configuration work of others. The role will work closely with the IT leadership team and our vendor partners from requirements through rollout.


Duties & Responsibilities

Work closely with the senior technical resources and global partners, to interpret and translate business requirements into solution technical designs.
Actively participate in configuration of the Claims solution. Completing critical configuration activities and solving the most complex problems.
Analyze complex technical or systems problems; design and implements effective solutions.
Work with technical staff to understand problems with software and develop specifications for improvements and enhancements.
Take a leadership role in developing technical scope, approach and implementation estimates.
Collaborate with the business to ensure proper understanding of the functional needs and how they translate into solution designs.
Develop overall application architecture and technical design deliverables for the Claim modules.
Engage in the assignment of work to development team resources, ensuring effective transition of knowledge, design assumptions and development expectations.
Establish processes that will facilitate the development of an integrated solution by disparate resources (employees and contractors) that will work from different locations.
Provide on-call support as needed.

Qualifications, Skills and Experience

Minimum of eight years of experience developing and delivering complex technology solutions.
Experience in developing technology solutions in support of Commercial Insurance Claim solutions.
Considered an expert by your peers in architecting solutions and configuring functionality within a Claims platform.
Guidewire or Duck Creek Claims is required.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, adept at working with remote IT teams.
Strong background in P&C Insurance.
Hands on style with strong problem solving abilities and a keen attention to detail.

Role Summary:

    You will be responsible for programing a component, feature and or feature set. Works independently and contributes to the immediate team and to other teams across business. You will also contribute to design discussions.

    Essential Responsibilities:

  • Provide technical leadership and defining, developing, and evolving software in a fast paced and agile development environment using the latest software development technologies and infrastructure
  • Apply principles of SDLC and methodologies like Lean/Agile/XP, CI, Software and Product Security, Scalability, Documentation Practices, refactoring and Testing Techniques
  • Expert in writing code that meets standards and delivers desired functionality using the technology selected for the project. Demonstrates the initiative to explore alternate technology and approaches to solving problems.
  • Proactively shares information across the team, to the right audience with the appropriate level of detail and timeliness
  • Capture system level requirements by brainstorming with Senior Architects, Data Scientists, Businesses, and Product Managers.
  • Identify the scope of the work, provide initial estimate and justify the estimate with facts.
  • Engage in technical discussions; participate in technical designs, and present technical ideas through white boarding.
  • Ensure that completed tasks are delivered to meet the product release goal. Maintain code quality through best practices, unit testing, and code quality automation.
  • Make informed technology choices after due diligence and impact assessment.
  • Serve as subject matter expert that meet standards and deliver the desired functionality using the technology selected for the project.
  • Assess application performance, then optimize and improve it through best coding practices to support software build, release, and deployment processes.
  • Experience with DevOps culture and automation
  • A strong focus on customer outcomes
  • A passion for delivering automation and software process productivity

    Qualifications/Requirements:

    Basic Qualifications:

  • Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or in “STEM” Majors (Science, Technology, Engineering and Math)
  • A minimum of 6 years of professional experience Computer Science OR Master’s degree with 4 years of experience software development (enterprise, web-based, etc)

    Eligibility Requirements:

  • Legal authorization to work in the U.S. is required. GE may agree to sponsor an individual for an employment visa now or in the future if there is a shortage of individuals with particular skills.

    Desired Characteristics:

  • Strong knowledge of Object Oriented Analysis and Design, Software Design Patterns and Java coding principles and TDD
  • Passionate about learning, adopting and contributing to Open Source software community
  • Willing to flex their muscles into other roles like code review, pair programming
  • Demonstrates clear understanding of high availability architecture, performance optimization, effective troubleshooting and debugging
  • Expert in cloud development in AWS and manage services Aurora, SQS, S3, EMR
  • Expert in Terraform, cloud automation scripting language.
  • Experienced with Spark and developing pyspark application.
  • Experienced in open source services such as Airflow and Genie and have developed against them.
  • Proficient in writing software build and deployment automations using Jenkins
  • Experience in managing version control systems (SVN, GIT, branching, merging etc…)
  • Demonstrates the initiative to explore alternate technology and approaches to solving problems
  • Skilled in breaking down problems, documenting problem statements and estimating efforts
  • Influences through others; builds direct and "behind the scenes" support for ideas. Preemptively sees downstream consequences and effectively tailors influencing strategy to support a positive outcome. Uses experts or other third parties to influence.
  • Able to verbalize what is behind decisions and downstream implications. Continuously reflecting on success and failures to improve performance and decision-making.
  • Understands when change is needed. Participates in technical strategy planning.
  • Strong oral and written communication skills
  • Strong interpersonal skills
  • Effective team building and problem solving abilities
  • Persists to completion, especially in the face of overwhelming odds and setbacks. Pushes self for results; pushes others for results through team spirit

Role Summary:

    The Staff Data Scientist in Power Digital Data Science & Analytics team will be responsible for delivering machine learning models, data science methods and analytics in a commercial
    technology and product development environment. In this role, you will contribute to the design, development and deployment of new, commercially re-usable analytics for addressing complex problems across power generation, transmission and distribution domains.

    Essential Responsibilities:

    As a Staff Data Scientist, you will be part of teams on commercially facing product development initiatives, involving domain and system understanding, large and complex data sets from multiple sources. These teams typically include data scientists, analytics engineers, data engineers, software developers, product managers, program managers and end users, working in concert with partners in GE Power and Digital businesses. Potential applications areas include asset performance management, asset monitoring and diagnostics, operations optimization, network level optimization, energy orchestration, outage response, risk assessment etc.

  • Build and lead development of physics aided AI and Machine Learning driven cutting edge analytics for Power Generation, Transmission & Distribution (T&D) product suites
  • Demonstrate solid engineering and domain knowledge in delivering innovative advanced analytics based solutions for power customers
  • Engage key technical & subject matter experts (SMEs) across the business for knowledge capture into the solutions. Work with Data Science & Analytics, Software Engineering, Product Management and other business functions to develop, verify, and validate analytics to address customer needs and opportunities across digital energy value chain
  • Demonstrate technical depth in building foundation for AI and Machine technologies for Power Generation, Transmission and Distribution analytics use cases
  • Collaborate with Power and Digital businesses to build differentiated applied analytics, predictive analytics and prescriptive analytics that fit the design and future of Power products
  • Work as part of a cross-functional team to translate algorithms into commercially viable products and services.
  • Work with data engineers on data quality assessment, data cleansing and data analytics
  • Apply a structured process to design and build new analytic packages and contribute to build out of most comprehensive Analytics Catalog for Power business
  • Contribute to technology forecasting and IP generation for the business
  • Work with customers to capture data and analytics requirements
  • Foster an environment that encourages innovation, creative risk taking, speed and agility

    Qualifications/Requirements:

    Basic Qualifications:

  • Master’s degree in a “STEM” major (Science, Technology, Engineering, Mathematics) plus 6 years analytics development for industrial applications in a commercial/industrial setting
    OR Ph.D. in a “STEM” major (Science, Technology, Engineering, Mathematics) plus 4 year analytics development for industrial applications in a commercial/industrial setting
  • Minimum of 3 years of engineering experience with hands on implementation of Data Science and Analytics/ AI & ML techniques for industrial applications

    Eligibility Requirements:

  • Legal authorization to work in the U.S. is required. GE may agree to sponsor an individual for an employment visa now or in the future if there is a shortage of individuals with particular skills.
  • Must be willing to work out of an office located in Atlanta, GA
  • Must be willing to travel to other GE and customer sites as required with < 10% travel anticipated

    Desired Characteristics:

  • Demonstrated expertise in the use of one or more of latest analytic software tools or packages (e.g., Python, R, SAS, JMP, SPSS etc.). Programming experience with open source scripting and other data analysis packages
  • Demonstrated expertise in data modeling, feature engineering, and the development and application of descriptive, applied, and predictive analytics on industrial data sets
  • Demonstrated expertise in data science methodologies, technology and industry trends
  • Demonstrated expertise in data visualization and storytelling to translate complex data into customer insights
  • Strong analytics skills with expertise in machine learning, statistical analysis, signal processing and data mining. Demonstrated skill in prescriptive analytics and analytic productization
  • Understanding of industrial equipment, processes and energy network operations, especially in the areas of power plants, transmission & distribution domain
  • Hands on experience with data management methods, analytics deployment and orchestration tools, database technologies and visualization tools for customer facing software applications
  • Proven track record of Innovation and IP generation
  • Strong customer mindset and ability to understand commercial and product strategy.
  • Demonstrates awareness of important current trends affecting the industries that GE Power Digital operates in
  • Experience working effectively on multiple outcome-focused commercial solutions simultaneously
  • Domain expertise in power generation, transmission & distribution space with broad understanding of energy products and services
  • Proactively engages with cross-functional teams to resolve issues and design solutions using critical thinking and analytics skills and best practices by actively incorporating input from various sources
  • Demonstrated expertise working in dynamic global team settings in prior roles
  • Demonstrated expertise in critical thinking and problem solving methods
  • Continuous improvement oriented – actively generates process improvements and drives change initiatives working in ambiguous environments
  • Must be a team player with a strong desire to win. Highly organized and efficient; able to balance competing priorities and execute accordingly

Bounteous is leading the charge in dynamic digital experiences and is looking for the right team members to drive those results. In our ever-changing, fast-paced digital world, our approach helps brands envision, harness, and enable their online and mobile presence.

Bounteous is seeking a Campaign Manager to join our team of talented professionals who provide web development and digital marketing services to clients large and small. This role will be a supervisor role overseeing the email, SMS, and push campaign team.

The Campaign Manager needs to be an independent worker who is very detail-oriented and highly organized. The role involves coordination across various creative agencies and our email service provider (Adobe Campaign Classic). A positive, client service-oriented, and problem-solving attitude is a must for this role that involves meeting the demands of both a fixed marketing calendar and frequent client requests. This job involves exacting standards and unforgiving schedules - the work must be done on time (although some items can be set-up in advance) and error-free. Work schedules will regularly include weekend hours to support a team of digital developers if problems with set-up occurs and to confirm successful campaign deployment.

Role and Responsibilities

  • Manage communication across clients, internal teams, and partner agencies on a daily basis
  • Organize, lead, and author meetings, detailed agendas, minutes, and project updates
  • Continuously update and manage client-facing planning calendars and campaign schedules
  • Set up email calendars, anticipating marketing-related holidays and events
  • Understand, plan, and implement complex audience targeting
  • Oversee QA for email designs, templates, outbound email campaigns with the goal of a 0% error rate
  • Perform campaign analysis to influence broader marketing strategy and contribute to client ROI in partnership with the Bounteous Analytics & Insight team
  • Create professional deliverables for clients that meet the Bounteous quality standard at all times
  • Develop and implement process efficiencies to assist our fast-paced team

Preferred Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s Degree
  • Creative/digital agency background required, including 2+ years of client-facing experience
  • Experience managing/overseeing a team required
  • Deep knowledge of and 5+ years of experience with email marketing best practices and innovations
  • 1+ year of experience independently managing email, SMS, push campaigns
  • Experience using web-based email management software (setting up, previewing, testing, troubleshooting, and monitoring email blasts)
  • Strong interpersonal skills including email, phone, and meeting-related communications
  • Experience working collaboratively with internal and external resources to develop strategies that meet department goals within budget and established timelines
  • Experience with web analytics a plus
Bounteous is focused on promoting an inclusive environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate the different viewpoints and experiences our diverse group of team members bring to Bounteous. Bounteous does not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, physical or mental disability, national origin, veteran status, or any other status protected under federal, state, or local law.

Bounteous is willing to sponsor eligible candidates for employment visas.
